resources.string: Amber beer has a reddish-brown color from caramel malts, offering a balance of malt sweetness and hop bitterness. It often features flavors of toffee, caramel, and toast. Versatile in food pairings, it\'s a favorite among craft beer lovers.

Light beer is characterized by its lower calorie and alcohol content, often resulting in a crisp and refreshing taste. It typically features a mild, clean flavor with less malt sweetness and hop bitterness. Its light profile makes it a popular choice for easy drinking and pairing with a variety of foods.

Brown beer is known for its deep, rich color and robust malt flavors, often including notes of chocolate, coffee, or nuts. It has a balanced profile with moderate sweetness and a subtle bitterness. Its full-bodied taste makes it a great choice for savoring with hearty foods.

Dark beer is distinguished by its deep, rich color and intense malt flavors, often featuring roasted coffee, chocolate, or caramel notes. It typically has a fuller body and a more pronounced sweetness or bitterness. Its bold profile pairs well with robust dishes and desserts.
